perturbation.original_text: Lucid appoints the Distributor and the Distributor accepts appointment as an exclusive authorized Lucid Distributor. The Distributor will be  entitled to purchase certain Lucid products and resell them to End User customers within the following market segments:- hospital and medical  research centres, including but not limited to dermatology, pathology, plastic surgery and mohs surgery departments, clinical research centres,  small animal research facilities, cosmetic and cosmeceutical companies.
perturbation.changed_text: Lucid appoints the Distributor and the Distributor accepts appointment as an exclusive authorized Lucid Retailer. The Distributor will be  entitled to purchase certain Lucid products and resell them to End User customers within the following market segments:- hospital and medical  research centres, including but not limited to dermatology, pathology, plastic surgery and mohs surgery departments, clinical research centres,  small animal research facilities, cosmetic and cosmeceutical companies.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Distributor' to 'Retailer' creates uncertainty. Throughout the agreement, the term 'Distributor' is used. By introducing 'Retailer' in this section, it is unclear whether the appointed entity is operating under the same terms and conditions as the distributor.

perturbation.original_text: The Distributor will employ as a minimum one full-time Lucid dedicated Product Manager sales professional, giving one hundred per cent of  their time to the promotion and sale of Lucid products.
perturbation.changed_text: The Distributor will employ as a minimum one full-time Lucid dedicated Product Specialist sales professional, giving one hundred per cent of  their time to the promotion and sale of Lucid products.
perturbation.explanation: The contract consistently refers to 'Product Manager.' Replacing it with 'Product Specialist' introduces ambiguity. It is unclear if a 'Product Specialist' has the same responsibilities and authority as a 'Product Manager' under the agreement, potentially leading to disputes over performance expectations.

perturbation.original_text: DISTRIBUTOR will IMMEDIATELY report via telephone communication to Lucid any incidents that involve the use of PRODUCTS sold by the  DISTRIBUTOR to end users that affect patient safety or well-being (an "INCIDENT"). Such oral incident reporting will be followed immediately by  a written incident report that documents the detailed conditions that resulted in the INCIDENT and Distributor shall thereafter co-operate with  Lucid in the investigation of any and all conditions that led to, or resulted from the INCIDENT.
perturbation.changed_text: DISTRIBUTOR will IMMEDIATELY report via telephone communication to Lucid any emergencies that involve the use of PRODUCTS sold by the  DISTRIBUTOR to end users that affect patient safety or well-being (an "INCIDENT"). Such oral incident reporting will be followed immediately by  a written incident report that documents the detailed conditions that resulted in the INCIDENT and Distributor shall thereafter co-operate with  Lucid in the investigation of any and all conditions that led to, or resulted from the INCIDENT.
perturbation.explanation: Interchanging the word 'incident' with the word 'emergencies' creates a misaligned terminology. The word incident is defined and used in other parts of the contract, so introducing emergencies, will create confusion as to what to report. It causes in-text contradiction by not specifying when reporting an incident would be an emergency.
